snippet: President Obama’s remarks on Saturday came at a summit meeting in Colombia where leaders discussed alternatives to what many consider a failed “war on drugs.”
abstract: Leaders at Summit of the Americas in Colombia discuss alternatives to so-called 'war on drugs,' that is considered too reliant on military action and imprisonment; Pres Obama rejects legalization, issue that was placed on the agenda by Colombia's president, Juan Manuel Santos; Santos says that he had in mind something short of fully decriminalizing the drug trade that for years has undermined societies throughout the region, notably in Colombia.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s remarks on Saturday came at a summit meeting in Colombia where leaders discussed alternatives to what many consider a failed “war on drugs.”

headline.main: Obama Says Legalization Is Not the Answer on Drugs
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Legalization Is Not the Answer on Drugs
